name: Feature
description: A new feature or enhancement to be added to the application.

name: Bug
description: A report for something that isn't working as expected.

name: Chore
description: Routine maintenance tasks, s uch as updates or refactoring

name: Documentation
description: Tasks related to writing or updating documentation.

name: Urgent
description: Issues that need immediate attention.

name: Discussion
description: Open-ended conversations or brainstorming sessions.

name: Design
description: Issues related to UI/UX design tasks.

name: Blocked
description: Tasks that cannot move forward until a blocker is resolved.

name: High Priority
description: Needs immediate attention and is a critical task.

name: Medium Priority
description: Important but not urgent.

name: Low Priority
description: Non-urgent tasks that can be scheduled for later.

name: In Progress
description: Actively being worked on.

name: On Hold
description: Temporarily paused.

name: Needs Review
description: Requires code review or testing before merging.

name: Ready for Deployment
description: Ready to be deployed to production.

name: Refactor
description: Refactoring code to improve readability or performance without changing functionality.

name: Hotfix
description: Critical fix that needs to be addressed immediately.

name: Research/Spike
description: Investigating a new tool, feature, or issue to determine the best course of action.

name: Tenant-Specific
description: Tasks related to a specific tenant in the multi-tenant architecture.

name: Performance Optimization
description: Tasks aimed at improving the performance of the application.

name: Security
description: Issues or tasks related to application security.

name: Client Feedback
description: Issues based on feedback from clients.

name: SLA Breach Imminent
description: An issue that is approaching the SLA breach window.

name: Backlog
description: Tasks in the backlog, waiting to be scheduled.

name: Ready for QA
description: Tasks ready for quality assurance testing.
